alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 4:52PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST/9 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona near Rough Rock, Round Rock, and Rock Point within Apache, County. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MST /900 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Unimproved roads may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 PM MST /550 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chinle Wash, Hasbidito Creek, Trading Post Wash, Burro Wash, Lukachukai Creek, Agua Sal Creek and Red Water Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Round Rock, Rock Point, Rough Rock and Navajo Reservation. - This includes Highway 191 between mile markers 468 and 496. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
